snippet: In trying to put a French imprint on the digital economy, Fleur Pellerin has found herself clashing with American technology companies.
abstract: French deputy finance minister Fleur Pellerin, in trying to put a French imprint on the digital economy, finds herself clashing with American technology companies; she ordered French internet service Free to restore full service to Google, whose advertising had been blocked, but made it clear French firm had legitimate grievance.

byline.original: By ERIC PFANNER and DAVID JOLLY

lead_paragraph: In trying to put a French imprint on the digital economy, Fleur Pellerin has found herself clashing with American technology companies.

headline.main: Pushing France Onto the Digital Stage
headline.print_headline: An Official Tries to Put a French Stamp on the Digital World
